page.title: 20OUTDOOR SPORTING AMENITIES
page.content: The North Shore Golf Club covers 94 acres of our grid section. It is very popular with local people, as well as with holiday visitors, who are very welcome to play. The Club has 510 golfing members, and 300 social, junior and country members. The course has 18 holes and is 6,400 yards long. The present clubhouse was opened in 1928, but before that the clubhouse was what is now the Deaf and Dumb Institute in Cornwall Avenue nearby. In 1963, the Duke of Edinburgh came by helicopter to the golf club; his visit was to launch an international golfing competition which was held to raise money for the Playing Fields Association. Other sporting amenities in the area include bowling greens, tennis courts, putting greens and a boating pool.
